intro: Meibomia cana, commonly known as the rough meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, with four to five petals. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Meibomia cana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
